body_html: I may also be affected by this issue in my Rainbow repo - same error and fix as #2473 - import cv2 after import torch seems to be working fine atm (running with gdb just in case), but I was getting a segfault after a while when the imports were the other way around. Using pip's opencv-python on Ubuntu 14.04.6 + CUDA 8.0 + Python 3.6 + conda PyTorch 0.3.
body_text: I may also be affected by this issue in my Rainbow repo - same error and fix as #2473 - import cv2 after import torch seems to be working fine atm (running with gdb just in case), but I was getting a segfault after a while when the imports were the other way around. Using pip's opencv-python on Ubuntu 14.04.6 + CUDA 8.0 + Python 3.6 + conda PyTorch 0.3.
body: I may also be affected by this issue in my [Rainbow repo](https://github.com/Kaixhin/Rainbow/blob/master/env.py) - same error and fix as #2473 - `import cv2` after `import torch` seems to be working fine atm (running with `gdb` just in case), but I was getting a segfault after a while when the imports were the other way around. Using `pip`'s `opencv-python` on Ubuntu 14.04.6 + CUDA 8.0 + Python 3.6 + `conda` PyTorch 0.3.
